intro: Schlechtendalia cancellata, commonly known as the veined legume, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its compound leaves with a distinctive veining pattern, and its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and agricultural contexts.
